edu.rit.crst

Class TransformGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.crst.Generator
      • edu.rit.crst.TransformGenerator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Add, Complement, Permute, Shift, Xor

    public abstract class TransformGenerator
extends Generator
    Class TransformGenerator is the abstract base class for an object that generates input values for a cryptographic Function.

    An instance of class TransformGenerator is layered on top of another input generator. The latter is specified as an argument to the TransformGenerator constructor, in the form of a constructor expression. The TransformGenerator constructor uses the constructor expression to create the underlying input generator. (For further information about constructor expressions, see class edu.rit.util.Instance.)

    Class TransformGenerator invokes the underlying input generator to generate a series of cryptographic function input values. Class TransformGenerator then calls the transform() method on each input value, and the result replaces that input value. The transformation is defined in a subclass.
